title: Beyonce's sister Solange Knowles goes braless onstage
title_page: Beyonce's sister Solange Knowles goes braless onstage | Daily Mail Online
text:
Beyonce's sister Solange Knowles wore a sexy purple one-shoulder top with matching loin-cloth hotpants and thigh-highs on Wednesday night.
The 30-year-old opted to go braless as she showed off some serious sass while on stage at a YouTube music showcase at the 2017 SXSW Conference and Festivals in Austin, Texas.
She wore her hair loose as she sported natural earthy tone make-up to perform to an eager crowd.
Scroll down for video
What a diva! Braless Solange Knowles wore a sexy purple one-shoulder top to perform at a YouTube music showcase at the 2017 SXSW Conference and Festivals in Texas on Wednesday
Hot style: Beyonce's sister wore matching loin-cloth hotpants and thigh-highs to perform
On trend, she squeezed into a stylish lilac tube top flaunting her feminine curves.
All eyes were on the diva when she flashed a hint of her generous cleavage in her sexy ensemble.
Beyonce's baby sister teamed the hot top with cherry-picked matching high waisted shorts and long knee-high socks.
Break out! The songstress couldn't be tamed when she stepped into the spotlight onstage for her live performance, with her raven curls roam loose as she pulled off a wild style
Besties: Big sister Beyonce revealed she was the Feelin' You hitmaker's number one fan
The American songstress, who did several stints on-board Destiny's Child, sported a wild look as she wore her voluminous tresses in a loose style.
The Feelin' You hitmaker was in her element looked relaxed as she oozed confidence onstage.
Earlier this year, the songstress revealed her feisty personality and ambition to succeed as she is determined to make a name for herself.
Time of her life: She boldly went braless in a tight tube top flashing her feminine curves. She teamed the attire with matching high waisted shorts and knee-high socks
She told Beyonce in a chat for Interview Magazine: 'I always knew what I wanted. We damn sure know that I wasn't always right. But I'd sit firm, whether I was right or wrong.'
And of course, the pregnant star told her little sister she is her biggest fan.
In full sister mode, she slammed this year's Grammy's when Beyonce lost out on the sought after title Album Of The Year to Adele.
